result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetrius O Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Monies due shall be paid at 50 per month commencing 2/1/2023; if payment is not made timely, judgment shall be entered.
There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demetrius O Scott

records.addlTxt: Defendant Demetrius O Scott in court.  Attorney Matthew Edward Weil in court for Demetrius O Scott.  Prosecuting attorney Daniel J Gabler in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Gabler indicates disposition of case includes defendant's agreement that the firearm shall not be recovered; law enforcement may destroy the firearm. Guilty plea entered on Ct. 2. Court finds def guilty on Ct. 2. Statements by Atty. Gabler; statements by Atty. Weil. Statements by Court; Court proceeds to sentencing.Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.
WCSO advised defendant has not complied with booking; defendant's attorney contacted to notify the defendant to comply with booking

Defendant Demetrius O Scott not in court.  Attorney Matthew Edward Weil in court for Demetrius O Scott.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not present, Counsel indicates defendant had medical issue and faxed information to the court earlier today; Not guilty plea entered by Court.
Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Demetrius O. Scott in court without counsel.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. $1,000 signature bond set.  Defendant referred to State Public Defender.
Hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Demetrius O Scott not in court. Defendant did contact the Clerk of Courts office to inform he was unable to appear today due to ongoing medical treatment.  Court finds probable cause.
